DUAL-SPORT STAR: View Maya Neal's Track Bio Page

CAREER HONORS

2019 United Coaches All-Region (second team)

2019 All-SEC (first team)

2019 MAC Hermann Trophy Preseason Watch List

2018 United Coaches All-Region (first team)

2018 All-SEC (first team)

2017 United Coaches All-Region (second team)

2017 All-SEC (first team)

2017 SEC Community Service Team

2016 NSCAA All-Region (third team)

2016 SEC All-Freshman Team

AS A REDSHIRT SENIOR (2019)

2019 All-SEC (first team)

2019 MAC Hermann Trophy Preseason Watch List

Started 17 matches during her final season on Rocky Top, finishing her career with 79 total starts (t-9th in program history)

Became the second Lady Vol to ever earn All-Region honors four years in a row, claiming a second team nod in 2019

Named First Team All-SEC to become one of five players in program history to earn all-conference honors all four years

Ranked third on the team with 1,449 minutes played as the anchor of Tennessee's back line

Only player on Tennessee's roster to see the field for every minute of league play

Played all 110 minutes in a 1-1 draw at No. 7 South Carolina (10/18)

Helped the Vols earn shutout victories over SEC East rivals Kentucky, Georgia and No. 20 Florida

Picked up her lone assist of the season in a 3-3 draw at UMass (9/15)

AS A REDSHIRT JUNIOR (2018)

2018 United Coaches All-Region (first team)

2018 All-SEC (first team)

Played and started in all 22 matches at center back for the Vols

Part of a back line that limited opponents to 15 goals on the year and recorded 12 shutouts, both setting program records

Led all position players with 1,810 minutes, averaging 82.3 minutes per contest

Recorded her lone assist of the season on Bunny Shaw's equalizer in the first round of the NCAA Tournament against Louisville (11/9)

AS A REDSHIRT SOPHOMORE (2017)

2017 United Coaches All-Region (second team)

2017 All-SEC (first team)

2017 SEC Community Service Team

Started all 21 matches at centerback, her first full season on defense

Named to 2017 SEC preseason watch list

Part of 10 shutouts during the season

Recorded a season-best two assists, one in a 3-1 win over Virginia Tech (9/10) and 2-0 win over Murray State in the NCAA Tournament (11/11)

AS A REDSHIRT FRESHMAN (2016)

2016 NSCAA All-Region (third team)

2016 SEC All-Freshman Team

Top Drawer Soccer Postseason Women's Freshmen Top 100 List (No. 31)

Top Drawer Soccer Midseason Women's Freshmen Top 100 List (No. 100)

Started 19 games this season and finished fourth on the team with three goals

Played a career-high 110 minutes in 2-2 draw at Kentucky (10/14)

Registered first-career assist in 2-0 win over Texas A&M (10/9)

Had two shots in 95 minutes of action in OT win over Indiana State (10/2)

Played full 90 minutes on the back four in a 2-0 shutout win at Georgia (9/22)

Played full 90 minutes in 2-0 shutout over Missouri (9/15)

Scored final goal in 3-0 win at American (9/4)

Scored opening goal in 3-2 win over ETSU (8/28)

Scored first collegiate goal in 77th minute of 1-0 win over Liberty (8/21)

Played 74 minutes and posted a career-best six shots in win over Liberty (8/21)

Made first-career start, playing 64 minutes in season opener vs. Southeast Missouri (8/19)

AS A FRESHMAN (2015)

Played 24 minutes in her first appearance as a Vol vs. Lipscomb (8/21)

Missed remainder of the season with an injury

HIGH SCHOOL/CLUB

Neal is ranked the No. 30 overall recruit in the IMG Academy 150

Is a dynamic athlete who will play soccer and run track at Tennessee

In 2014, she helped lead her club team, Eclipse Select to a USYSA Regional Championship, the Disney Soccer Showcase title and a runner-up finish at ECNL Nationals

Was named to the ECNL Nationals Best XI U-17 team in 2014 when she scored 14 goals in the fall/winter regular season

Attended U.S. U-18 Women's National Team Camp in Dec. 2013

Is a five-time All-American and eight-time all-state honoree in track & field, specializing in the heptathlon (4,904 points) and the long jump (19'4.75")

Was the 2012 AAU National Champion in the heptathlon in track & field

PERSONAL

Majoring in Political Science

Chose Tennessee over Notre Dame, Florida State and Arkansas

High school extracurricular activities include Girl Scouts of America Ambassador and community service activities

Received the Gold Award and the Presidents Award (community service)

Says her biggest thrill in soccer was training with Michelle Akers and the ECNL National final in 2014

Her goals are to make the Olympics for track and to make the U.S. Women's National Team for soccer

Parents are Sherman Neal and Michelle Neal

Has two older brothers in the military, Capt. Sherman Neal II and 2nd Lt. Denzel Neal

Says her brothers are her biggest sports influence as they have been the greatest example of a warrior spirit

Maya Camille Neal was born on Dec. 22, 1996, in Naperville, Ill.

Recipient of the Mallicote Family Women's Athletic Endowed Scholarship

Also a member of the Tennessee Track & Field team (CLICK HERE for her track bio)
